message.content: This question requires knowledge about the effects of acid rain on the body and how the organs are protected. Option (A) is the correct answer because the outer organs, such as the skin, can act as a physical barrier and protect the internal organs from being directly harmed by acid rain. Option (B) is incorrect because being given immunity would not directly protect the organs from acid rain. Option (C) is incorrect because sunscreen is used to protect the skin from UV radiation, not acid rain. Option (D) is incorrect because taking vitamins does not provide direct protection against the effects of acid rain on the organs.

This question requires a basic understanding of the effects of acid rain on the body. Acid rain contains harmful chemicals that can damage organs if they come into direct contact. Option (A) is the correct answer because the outer organs, such as the skin, provide a protective layer that can prevent direct contact with the acid rain. Option (B) is incorrect because being given immunity would not specifically protect the organs from acid rain. Option (C) is incorrect because sunscreen is used to protect the skin from UV rays and not acid rain. Option (D) is incorrect because taking vitamins does not provide a direct protection against acid rain.

Option (D) is also unrelated to acid rain protection as vitamins do not provide any specific defense against it.
